macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Stabilizes Around $90,000 Amid Market Stability
items.summary: Bitcoin prices are holding steady near $90,000 as the global cryptocurrency market capitalization remains at $3.2 trillion with little change over the past day. Altcoins show mixed dynamics, with some recovering and others under pressure.

items.title: Bitcoin Futures Weaker, Hovering Near Recent Lows
items.summary: February Bitcoin futures prices are weaker in early trading on January 29, with prices technically hovering near recent lows and showing limited new developments.

items.title: Ethereum Network Activity Grows with Scaling Upgrades and ETF Inflows
items.summary: Ethereum sees increased transaction volumes, high DeFi TVL, and developer focus on scaling upgrades to reduce fees. New ETFs targeting ETH and altcoin baskets are driving capital inflows.

items.title: XRP Strengthens to $2.10 on Adoption and Regulatory Clarity
items.summary: Ripple's XRP has gained value, holding around $2.10, bolstered by resolved regulatory issues and growing adoption for cross-border payments by financial firms.

items.title: Chainlink Enters Top Ten After Spot ETF Launch
items.summary: Chainlink (LINK) surged into the top ten cryptocurrencies by market cap earlier this month due to double-digit growth following the launch of its first spot ETF.

items.title: Institutional Interest Surges with Rising Futures Open Interest
items.summary: Open interest in Bitcoin futures and options has increased over 10% since the year began, alongside new altcoin and ETH ETFs, signaling growing institutional activity.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Hardware AI Market Projected to Reach $27.1 Billion by 2030
items.summary: The hardware artificial intelligence market is expected to grow from $12.39 billion in 2026 to $27.1 billion by 2030, driven by demand for GPUs, edge AI, and energy-efficient chips. Leading firms like AMD and Nvidia are advancing AI accelerators and making strategic acquisitions.

items.title: Berkeley Lab AI and Automation Accelerate Synthetic Jet Fuel Production
items.summary: Researchers at Berkeley Lab developed an AI-driven automated pipeline using robotics and machine learning to optimize microbial strains for synthetic jet fuel, achieving 10-100 times faster results than traditional methods. The approach combines genetic engineering with biosensors for efficient biofuel production.

items.title: FDA and EMA Align on Ten Principles for AI in Drug Development
items.summary: The FDA and EMA have agreed on ten principles to guide the responsible use of artificial intelligence in drug development, emphasizing safety, transparency, and ethical standards.

items.title: Innodata Selected by Palantir for AI-Powered Rodeo Modernization
items.summary: Innodata has been chosen by Palantir to provide data engineering and annotation services, accelerating advanced AI initiatives in the Rodeo modernization project.

items.title: Stevens Institute Establishes School of Computing with AI Focus
items.summary: Stevens Institute of Technology announced a new School of Computing launching in fall 2026, integrating AI across interdisciplinary programs to prepare technology leaders.

items.title: National Study: Colleges Experimenting with AI but Lacking Strategy
items.summary: A T3 Advisory study of over 30 colleges reveals widespread AI experimentation in higher education, but most institutions struggle with governance, leadership, and scaling beyond pilots.

items.title: DeepSeek Math V2 Advances AI Capabilities
items.summary: DeepSeek Math V2 is highlighted for quietly building the future of AI through enhanced mathematical reasoning and model performance.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Potential GTA 6 Trailer at February State of Play
items.summary: Sony's upcoming mid-February State of Play may feature a new GTA VI trailer, according to PlayStation YouTuber MBG, amid fan anticipation for gameplay footage following the last trailer in May 2025. The game is set for release on November 19, 2026.

items.title: Xbox Gaming Revenue Drops 9% Amid Hardware Sales Decline
items.summary: Microsoft reports a 9% decline in Xbox gaming revenue and 32% drop in hardware sales year-over-year during the holiday period, marking three years of hardware declines despite releases like Gears of War Reloaded and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. Content and services revenue fell 5%, with no recent Game Pass subscriber updates.

items.title: Open Gaming Collective Launches Upstream First Linux Gaming Initiative
items.summary: The Open Gaming Collective announced an 'Upstream First' approach for Linux gaming on January 28-29, 2026, to reduce duplication, shared via OGC site, Bazzite forum, and founding members.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield Launches with Banners and Events
items.summary: Arknights: Endfield has launched with ongoing headhunting banners like 'Scars of the Forge' until February 7, launch reward codes valid until January 29, Twitch Drops, and Voyage to the Stars event until March 4.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Samsung Chip Profits Soar on Memory Demand
items.summary: Samsung reported record profits in its chip business driven by strong memory demand, expecting the boom to continue into Q1. SK Hynix also saw benefits from the same trend, with Elon Musk noting memory chips as a bigger constraint than AI chips.

items.title: Sony and Singapore’s GIC to Invest $2B in Music Catalogs
items.summary: Sony and Singapore’s GIC announced a $2 billion investment in music catalogs. The deal highlights ongoing consolidation in the music industry.

items.title: Advantest Surges After Raising Earnings Forecast
items.summary: Chip testing equipment maker Advantest's stock surged following strong earnings and an upward revision to its forecast. The move reflects robust demand in the semiconductor sector.

items.title: Nokia CEO Highlights US-Europe Tech Co-Dependence
items.summary: Nokia CEO Justin Hotard stated that Europe and the US are co-dependent for tech companies, urging the EU to support its champions amid moves to phase out high-risk vendors like Huawei. This could create opportunities for Nokia in telecom gear.
